Name: Relief fragment
Description: A limestone fragment, possibly part of a relief. On the right side is a man kneeling with his arms raised in a gesture of adoration, facing left. Before him are three vertical columns of hieroglyphs, part of a larger inscription. The figure of the man is bare-headed and he wears a long kilt but no ornamentation, he does not wear sandals.The stone is very smooth on the decorated face, the figure and inscription are very finely worked.
